A fantastic, mind-bending game of hilarious proportions, Portal 2 succeeds in all areas. The game, like it's prequel, revolves almost entirely around the use of a device known as the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device, which is able to create two individual wormholes, which are connected as doorways to each other.
However, the game also adds several new mechanics to the classic Portal gameplay, such as special gels. The script never feels forced, and is always comedic, with superb voice work. With long game time, fantastic script, and absolutely genius puzzles and level design, there is no reason to miss this one

After the original Portal set in place the physics, the mindset, and the setting, Portal 2 drops you back into Aperture Laboratories and lets you off on an incredible adventure to solve mindbending puzzles. Just don't think it'll be easy; if you want to escape Aperture Science, you have to think outside the box. You have to think with Portals.
The game that introduced me into Steam
This game is pretty swish.

'You monster.'

Less religious experience-y than the first one. But there's still a few lines which make me weak in the knees. The fact that it's a substantially bigger and better game than the first helps soften the blow, too.

'You don't know pride.'

'You don't know fear.'

'You don't know anything.'

'You'll be *perfect*.'

I feel like Portal is so well known in pop-culture I don't really need to go into too much detail here.  Portal 2 delivers everything its predecessor did and much more.  Same humor, same gameplay conventions, but with enough new content to be a worthy sequel.  It's also very pleasing to say it is far meatier than Portal 1.  There's a solid 8+ hours here on your first playthrough, not including the multiplayer component.  Just play it.  It's true Valve-quality gaming.  The only thing I would criticize is that there were too many parts where you enter an enormous room, and have to find the tiny portal surface somewhere.
Really good puzzle game with action and FUN!

Un jeu tout simplement superbe. 

Avoir finit Portal 1 n'est pas un maigre atout. Il permet l'experience des concepts portal et de connaître le début de l'histoire qui lie notre pauvre cobaye et "Aperture Science". 

Mais ce concept est tout de fois bien réexpliqué dans Portal 2, qui ne manque pas de rendre au fil du jeu la tâche de plus en plus difficile. En plus d'être plus long que son premier volet, Portal 2 reste très instinctif et ne lasse jamais le joueur. Le jeu est une succession d'enigmes noyées dans une histoire qui ne manque pas d'humour. Cette campagne solo vous fera voyager, ou plutôt bondir, dans un monde aux graphismes propres, et aux ambiances variées.

Une fois la campagne solo terminée, ou pas, vous pourrez relever les défis des salles additionnelles dans le contenu partagé par la communauté. Ce mode de jeu existait dans Portal 1, mais Portal 2 rajoute un élément qui ne manque pas de succès : La Coopération multijoueur. En effet, Portal 2 vous offre la possibilité d'affronter un bon nombre de nouvelles épreuves, cette fois-ci en binome, dans la peau de deux robots très cool. Chacun ayant besoin l'un de l'autre, coordination et entente seront requises. Juste des heures de funs en plus....

Essayer c'est l'adopter. Gl&Hf.

This game is much more than it looks like. :o In this geniously made game, you find yourself trapped in a dusty, clinical envoirment. Though it seems repetative in the beginning, you soon found yourself thrown into a GREAT adventure that may take your breath away. :) In this game you have to use your brain instead of weapons to keep going. :) The game has a nice (but mysterious) storyline, which unpredictably takes exciting turns to keep the action there. I think that this is the best game I have ever played, :D so I encourage you to get your hands on this brilliant adventure, which includes both Co-operation levels and a Singleplayer storyline. This game needs a 8/10. ;D
'Tis fun, but requires a very intelligent person to understand it.

Tryb kooperacji wymaga znacznie więcej myślenia (najlepiej z obu stron), ale sprawia jeszcze więcej frajdy z gry.

Testing is probably the right thing to say about Portal 2, with all the puzzles in the game it is nearly impossible to get a grasp on all of them in an instant. But why doing all that brain-hurting stuff alone? Just take a friend with you - even if the story differs.
But what makes Portal 2 this good? I played alot of it already and tested a lot of user created maps in the workshop, which is another great feature, they were really hard and i enjoyed to solve them alone or with friends even if you sometime get to a point where you are just frustrated because you just can't find the right way to do it.
Anyway - Portal 2 is on of the best an funniest game i've ever played and so should you - have fun and good luck!

Portal 2 has a lot it has to live up to.  The original Portal is considered a modern classic,  and it was also pretty self-contained; there isn’t much room for expansion.  However, Portal 2 managed to not only expand on the gameplay of the original, but the story as well.  It’s an impressive and somewhat risky feat, and the developers managed to do it flawlessly.
